thread.title: Kangana Ranaut SHATTERED after the makers of Rangoon chopped her scenes
thread.title_full: Kangana Ranaut SHATTERED after the makers of Rangoon chopped her scenes

author: IANS
title: Kangana Ranaut SHATTERED after the makers of Rangoon chopped her scenes
text:
Kangana Ranaut SHATTERED after the makers of Rangoon chopped her scenes Kangana Ranaut is unhappy after a few of her crucial scenes were cut from Rangoon... By IANS | Published: February 24, 2017 8:22 pm Shahid Kapoor and Mira Rajput sport similar hairdos for a lunch date – check out pics 
National Award-winning actress Kangana Ranaut says she felt shattered when a few of her important scenes were edited by the makers of Rangoon . Directed by Vishal Bhardwaj, Rangoon also stars Saif Ali Khan and Shahid Kapoor . The film was released today and while Kangana has got a lot of praise for her fantastic act, the film has received mixed reviews from the critics. Set during World War II, the film is an action drama with a complicated love triangle. 
While Kangana is happy, she was shocked after hearing that her part was cut. Talking about her scenes being chopped, Kangana mentioned in a statement, “I never thought people would appreciate my performance as many of my scenes were cut. They were important for my graph. When I came to know that a lot of my scenes were cut, my hopes were shattered. I thought people would just find my work average. But in spite of that people like it so much so I’m very happy.” ALSO READ – Why is Rangoon an important film for Kangana Ranaut? 
Earlier, it was revealed that Kangana ‘s character in the film is loosely based on actress-stuntwoman Fearless Nadia. However, in an interview with IANS earlier, Kangana said, “I think there is some legal hassle around that. First of all, we cannot comment on a matter when it’s already in the court, but we can assure you that it (my character) is not based on any living or dead person.” ALSO READ – Rangoon movie review: Kangana Ranaut, Shahid Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan’s earnest performances make Vishal Bhardwaj’s film worthy Published: February 24, 2017 8:22 pm Topics:
